brief.why: Chrome Debug is an implementation detail leaking into the name. This is Claude's browser — a first-class browsing environment where Claude has authenticated, visible, observable web access. The name should reflect that: Forage = going out to gather raw ingredients before mise preps them. Extends the kitchen metaphor (forage → mise → serve). Also packaging this for the team — needs a name that communicates purpose, not plumbing.
brief.what: 1. Rename user-facing commands (chrome-debug → forage, browse → forage) 2. Rename macOS app (Chrome Debug.app → Forage.app, update Info.plist CFBundleIdentifier/Name) 3. Rename data directory (~/.chrome-debug → ~/.forage — do when browser not running, preserves SSO session) 4. Update skill-chrome-log scripts (chrome-debug.sh → forage.sh, install.sh, shell-config.sh) 5. Update chrome-log CLI references (chrome_log.py, daemon.py — paths and hint messages) 6. Update SKILL.md, CLAUDE.md, README.md, llms.txt in skill-chrome-log 7. Update references/WEBCTL_INTEGRATION.md 8. Update status page (assets/status.html — 2 references) 9. Update mise-en-space (adapters/cdp.py, adapters/genai.py, tools/fetch.py, server.py, docs/information-flow.md, CLAUDE.md — 12 references) 10. Update webctl fork (CLAUDE.md, session_manager.py) 11. Update ~/.local/bin/browse wrapper 12. Update ~/.claude/CLAUDE.md (global instructions, 2 references)
brief.done: All user-facing references say Forage not Chrome Debug. forage command starts the browser. ~/.forage holds the profile. chrome-log still captures (internal name unchanged — it logs Chrome traffic, that's accurate). install.sh creates Forage.app. Team can set up with: forage start

title: Rename core scripts and data directory

brief.why: The foundation — everything else references these. Must be done first, when Chrome Debug is not running.
brief.what: 1. Rename scripts/chrome-debug.sh → scripts/forage.sh (update USER_DATA_DIR to ~/.forage, update echo messages) 2. Rename ~/.chrome-debug → ~/.forage (preserves profile + SSO cookies — just a mv) 3. Update shell-config.sh alias (chrome-debug → forage) 4. Update install.sh (app name, bundle ID, alias, echo messages) 5. Test: forage starts Chrome, ~/.forage/logs/ captures traffic
brief.done: forage command launches Chrome with profile at ~/.forage. Existing SSO session works after directory move.

brief.why: The Dock icon and app launcher need the new name and identity. Consider a new icon — current hue-shifted Chrome icon won't make sense as 'Forage'.
brief.what: 1. Rename ~/Applications/Chrome Debug.app → ~/Applications/Forage.app 2. Update Info.plist: CFBundleIdentifier → local.forage-launcher, CFBundleName → Forage 3. Update launch script path inside app (Contents/MacOS/launch → points to forage.sh) 4. Consider icon — hue-shifted Chrome says 'alt Chrome', Forage might want its own icon 5. Update install.sh to create Forage.app instead of Chrome Debug.app
brief.done: Forage.app in ~/Applications, launches correctly, Dock icon works

title: Update chrome-log CLI and daemon references

brief.why: chrome-log itself stays named chrome-log (it logs Chrome traffic — accurate). But its hint messages and path defaults reference chrome-debug which becomes forage.
brief.what: 1. scripts/chrome_log.py: update CHROME_DEBUG_DIR → FORAGE_DIR (~/.forage), update hint messages ('Start it with: forage') 2. scripts/daemon.py: update default log path (~/.forage/logs), update error message ('Start Chrome with: forage') 3. Keep chrome-log as the CLI/daemon name — only rename what users see about the browser
brief.done: chrome-log status shows 'Forage: Running/Not running'. chrome-log start looks in ~/.forage/logs/. Hint messages say forage not chrome-debug.

brief.why: SKILL.md is what Claude reads. CLAUDE.md is what future Claudes read about the repo. README is for humans. All need to reflect Forage.
brief.what: 1. SKILL.md: chrome-debug → forage throughout, update quick start examples, update architecture table 2. CLAUDE.md: update key paths (~/.forage/), update troubleshooting, update design decisions section 3. README.md: update setup instructions, path table, troubleshooting 4. llms.txt: update script descriptions and workflow 5. references/WEBCTL_INTEGRATION.md: chrome-debug → forage throughout (or mark deprecated if webctl integration superseded by mise CDP) 6. assets/status.html: update 2 user-facing strings
brief.done: All docs reference Forage consistently. No chrome-debug in user-facing text.

title: Update downstream repos (mise, webctl, browse, global CLAUDE.md)

brief.why: Other repos reference chrome-debug. These are separate commits in separate repos but should happen together.
brief.what: 1. mise-en-space: adapters/cdp.py (3 refs), adapters/genai.py (2 refs), tools/fetch.py (3 refs), server.py (1 ref), docs/information-flow.md (1 ref), CLAUDE.md (4 refs) — total 14 refs 2. webctl: CLAUDE.md (3 refs), src/webctl/daemon/session_manager.py (1 ref) 3. ~/.local/bin/browse: update to open -a Forage 4. ~/.claude/CLAUDE.md: update browser references in 'Accessing Authenticated Web Pages' and 'Opening URLs for Inspection' sections
brief.done: No downstream repo references chrome-debug. browse command opens Forage. Global CLAUDE.md says forage.
